title: Princess Margaret confidante throws shade at Vanessa Kirby’s in The Crown
text:

Lady Anne Glenconner has spoken out about helping Helena Bonham Carter research for The Crown, casually throwing shade at Vanessa Kirby’s portrayal of Princess Margaret in the process.

Glenconner was Princess Margaret’s lady-in-waiting for three decades before her death in 2002, and has since written a book titled Lady In Waiting about her experience.

Speaking on Loose Women, Glenconner was partly inspired to write the book after Helena Bonham Carter came to ask advice on portraying Margaret in The Crown’s third season.

‘I knew her [Helena Bonham Carter]. She’s a cousin of my husband, and her father was very helpful when my third son had a terrible motorbike accident and was in a coma.

Helena Bonham Carter as Princess Margaret in The Crown (Picture: Netflix)

‘Anyway she said, “Can I come and see you? I just want to talk to you about Princess Margaret.” She came and she’s wonderful, she’s going to be the most perfect Princess Margaret.

‘I mean she’s the right size, she looks right. They’ve got the sort of intelligence of Princess Margaret with her, she wanted to know everything about her. She’s got the right voice.’

Despite admitting to only watching the show ‘occasionally’ on certain episodes, she believes Vanessa Kirby, who played the princess in the first two seasons, wasn’t an ideal fit.

After Janet Street-Porter brought up Vanessa, Lady Glenconner replied: ‘Yes she was. I didn’t think she was quite right.

‘But that was only my opinion.’

Vanessa Kirby as Margaret in The Crown seasons one and two (Picture: Netflix)

She was also partly inspired after book Ma’am Darling by Craig Brown was published, which she claims was littered with false facts about the princess.

‘That’s partly why I wrote my book. I was so angry with his book. It was so untrue, he didn’t know her, ‘ Glenconner said.

‘And what I really mind is all these people who write all this rubbish about people like Princess Margaret when they haven’t even met them.

‘She’s such a friend and she was so wonderful to me. And I just wanted to put the record straight.’
